page.name: Ancient Text
page.description: Return this book and other books to Loremaster Maya in Oaklore Keep.

properties.name: Ancient Text
properties.description: Return this book and other books to Loremaster Maya in Oaklore Keep.

page.name: Sir Koffagus Sarcophagus
page.description: The undead knight Sir Koffagus has fallen to you in battle. As a reward he has let you take a weapon from his horde.

properties.name: Sir Koffagus Sarcophagus
properties.description: The undead knight Sir Koffagus has fallen to you in battle. As a reward he has let you take a weapon from his horde.
properties.complete: The undead knight Sir Koffagus has fallen to you in battle. As a reward he has let you take a weapon from his horde.

page.name: The VurrMen Ruins
page.description: These ruins once stood tall and proud, but all things change. Hundreds of years have passed and the ruins of the great city are now infested with VurrMen and Tuskmongers, drawn by the many mysterious objects that can still be found here.

properties.name: The VurrMen Ruins
properties.description: These ruins once stood tall and proud, but all things change. Hundreds of years have passed and the ruins of the great city are now infested with VurrMen and Tuskmongers, drawn by the many mysterious objects that can still be found here.
properties.complete: These ruins once stood tall and proud, but all things change. Hundreds of years have passed and the ruins of the great city are now infested with VurrMen and Tuskmongers, drawn by the many mysterious objects that can still be found here.

page.name: Sir Jing's Weapons
page.description: You find yourself at the base of a mountain surrounded by storm elementals. They have gathered to use the power of Sir Jing's weapons to create a never-ending storm!

properties.name: Sir Jing's Weapons
properties.description: You find yourself at the base of a mountain surrounded by storm elementals. They have gathered to use the power of Sir Jing's weapons to create a never-ending storm!
properties.complete: You have fought your way up the mountain and stopped the storm elementals from summoning a never-ending storm! For the sake of the world, you must take Sir Jing's weapon for safe keeping.

page.name: The Keep Invasion
page.description: Oaklore Keep has been invaded by a force of sneaky sneevils! They seem to be after one of two Ironwood Boxes that were delivered to the Knights of the Pactogonal Table, but which is the real chest?

properties.name: The Keep Invasion
properties.description: Oaklore Keep has been invaded by a force of sneaky sneevils! They seem to be after one of two Ironwood Boxes that were delivered to the Knights of the Pactogonal Table, but which is the real chest?
properties.complete: You saved the tower but Sneevil ninajs escaped with the real Ironwood Box, and you were left with the DECOY BOX!  It looks like you will have to get it back from the King Splurt himself!

page.name: Sneevil-Jitsu Dojo
page.description: You have come directly to the home of the Sneevil Ninja Army to find out about their plans to attack Oaklore keep.

properties.name: Sneevil-Jitsu Dojo
properties.description: You have come directly to the home of the Sneevil Ninja Army to find out about their plans to attack Oaklore keep.
properties.complete: Shogun Snizix confessed his plans to invade Oaklore Keep in a daring daylight attack and added, laughing: "You too late, human! Sneevil Ninja attack is already happenings! The Kings will haves his SPECIAL BOX!". Quick! To the Keep!

page.name: Sneevil Boxopolis
page.description: The sneevils stole an Ironwood Box intended for the Knights of Oaklore Keep when they invaded. You must enter their Boxopolis high in the trees of Oaklore forest and retrieve the box.

properties.name: Sneevil Boxopolis
properties.description: The sneevils stole an Ironwood Box intended for the Knights of Oaklore Keep when they invaded. You must enter their Boxopolis high in the trees of Oaklore forest and retrieve the box.
properties.complete: It turns out that King Splurt had no interest in the contents of the box, but simply in the box itself. However, you taught them a valuable lesson about taking things that do not belong to them.

page.name: For The Birds
page.description: You find yourself in Oaklore forest searching for a large sack of seeds stolen from the camp of Sir Vey.

properties.name: For The Birds
properties.description: You find yourself in Oaklore forest searching for a large sack of seeds stolen from the camp of Sir Vey.
properties.complete: The Forest Furies were gathered around the sack and eating the seeds hungrily as if they hadn't eaten in weeks. They began attacking you to defend the sack.

page.name: The Mollo Tree
page.description: Sir Vey has sent you into Oaklore forest to see what has caused the Forest Furies to stop eating their normal diet of Mollo fruit.

properties.name: The Mollo Tree
properties.description: Sir Vey has sent you into Oaklore forest to see what has caused the Forest Furies to stop eating their normal diet of Mollo fruit.
properties.complete: When you arrived at the Mollo tree it was being guarded by Vurr'men and the ground had been picked clean of the fallen fruit.

page.name: A Piece Of (Fruit)Cake!
page.description: Sir Vey has asked you to go to the lair of the Vurr'men hidden within the ancient ruins and recover the stolen Mollo fruit to try and restore the natural balance of the forest.

properties.name: A Piece Of (Fruit)Cake!
properties.description: Sir Vey has asked you to go to the lair of the Vurr'men hidden within the ancient ruins and recover the stolen Mollo fruit to try and restore the natural balance of the forest.
properties.complete: You find the fruit of the Mollo tree being stored by the Vurr'men in large barrels but every single piece of fruit is rotten.

page.name: Missing Equipment
page.description: Upon returning to the camp with a sample of the rotten Mollo fruit, Sir Vey has asked you to head to the river and find the testing equipment that he left on the bank of the river.

properties.name: Missing Equipment
properties.description: Upon returning to the camp with a sample of the rotten Mollo fruit, Sir Vey has asked you to head to the river and find the testing equipment that he left on the bank of the river.
properties.complete: You have found Sir Vey's missing equipment but it was a rough fight getting through the cave in the forest. The activity of the Vurr'men must have really thrown things out of whack.

page.name: Burn It All!
page.description: Sir Vey has discovered that the fermented Mollo fruit produced a chemical that can be used in mind control. Whatever the plans of the Vurr'men are, they must be stopped!

properties.name: Burn It All!
properties.description: Sir Vey has discovered that the fermented Mollo fruit produced a chemical that can be used in mind control. Whatever the plans of the Vurr'men are, they must be stopped!
properties.complete: Deep in the tunnels beneath the ruins you find the rest of the rotten Mollo fruit being guarded by a Vurr'man Alchemist. You have destroyed the fruit but you have found a mysterious note.

page.name: The Sweetest Thing
page.description: Sir Junn in Oaklore Keep has asked you to head to the hive of the Oaklore Buzzers and recover a small jar of Royal Honey, the sweetest substance in the realm.

properties.name: The Sweetest Thing
properties.description: Sir Junn in Oaklore Keep has asked you to head to the hive of the Oaklore Buzzers and recover a small jar of Royal Honey, the sweetest substance in the realm.
properties.complete: You defeated the Royal Buzzer and with the honey sample in hand you head back to Oaklore for a well deserved bath. You're very very very sticky.

page.name: The Hydra's Lair
page.description: You have come down to the cliffs outside Oaklore forest and into the caves that the Hydras call home. These monsters seem to be spawning faster and faster, and soon they will overrun the river unless you stop them!

properties.name: The Hydra's Lair
properties.description: You have come down to the cliffs outside Oaklore forest and into the caves that the Hydras call home. These monsters seem to be spawning faster and faster, and soon they will overrun the river unless you stop them!
properties.complete: The Hydras numbers have been thinned and Oaklore forest is safe from the watery menace for a little while.
